documentation: Elasticsearch is a distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine. This image can be used for single nodes and cluster setups. Look at https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docker.html for further assistance using Elasticsearch with docker.

instructions.start: Elasticsearch startearch engine. Be sure to extend the virtual memory on all your hosts! (increase "echo 'vm.max_map_count=262144' >> /etc/sysctl.conf" and restart "sysctl -p")
instructions.end: Deployment of Elasticsearch is finished. You might see 502 errors for the next 2 minutes. Goto <YOUR-APP-URL>/_cat/health to check the health of your cluster.

variables.label: Cluster Name
variables.description: Only nodes within the same cluster name can be combined

variables.label: Unicasts hosts
variables.description: References to other node to attach to. (for example: srv-captain--XXX)

variables.label: Node Data
variables.description: Should the node used for storing data? (true / false)

variables.label: Node Master
variables.description: Define node as master-eligible (usual first node YES, others NO).

variables.label: Minimum Master Nodes
variables.description: Define minimum amount of master (N) ( best practice: ceil(N/2 + 1) ).

variables.label: Container TCP Port
variables.description: Internal port for Elasticsearch the container listens to.
